tipo_fields.display_name: Definitions for determining actual and potential severity

tipo_fields.default_value:
Actual Impact and Potential Impact

Health. Employee well-being and health.

Safety. Physical safety and safety incidents.

Environment. Environmental impact and conservation.

Community. Building and maintaining relationships.

Reputation. Reputation protection.

Legal. Legal compliance and standards.

Financial. Financial integrity and compliance.

Process Safety. Industrial process safety.

Security. Physical asset security.

Cyber. Cybersecurity and data protection.

Actual Consequence and Maximum Reasonable Outcome

1 - MINOR. No injury or Illness. Impact of <1$K. Loss of up to 1 hour of production.

2 - MEDIUM. First Aid treatment. No Lost time. Impact of $1K - $10K. Loss of 1 to 6 hours of production.

3 - SERIOUS. Temporary disability: lost-time injury or illness. Impact of $10K - $100K. loss of 6 – 12 hours of production.

4 - MAJOR. Serious event: critical injury or critical illness. Impact of $100K - $1M. Loss of 3 – 7 days of production.

5 - CATASTROPHIC. Fatality or permanent disability. Impact of over 1$M. Loss of more than 7 days of production.
A 5-Why Root Cause Analysis should be completed for an incident with this potential severity level.
An Essential Factors Root Cause Analysis should be completed for an incident with this potential severity level.

tipo_fields.field_description: Enter a short description of the incident
This description will be updated in the overview section as well.
Describe any immediate actions taken following the incident
Provide any evidence e.g. pictures/other to help convey information regarding the incident
Please consult with your Corporate Administrator when using this classification.
